<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Bebilith](/Monsters.aspx?ID=568)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

While [demons](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=28) control much of the [Abyss](/Planes.aspx?ID=13), even they are hunted in the wilder regions of this horrific plane. The most notorious of these predators—though not the deadliest—is the bebilith. These fiends resemble elephant-sized spiders with glowing eyes, barbed chitin, and a fanged maw dripping caustic fluid.

Many demons and planar travelers have underestimated bebiliths' devious intellects, believing them to be little more than oversized vermin. Bebiliths take advantage of this, ambushing foes with unexpected tactics. While they lash out at any creatures they encounter, they take great pleasure in chewing on demonic flesh. [Qlippoth](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=146) are the only creatures bebiliths never consume.

[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +19, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +23, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +21, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +19

</row>

</column>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 30 

**Fort** +22 

**Ref** +19 

**Will** +19 

</row>

**HP** 200

**Weaknesses**
good 10

**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** <actions string="Reaction" /> 

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 35 feet, climb 15 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +23 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d10+13 piercing plus Abyssal rot

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +23 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d8+13 slashing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
web +23 ([range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)),
**Damage** dimensional tether

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 29
- **7th**
[Plane Shift](/Spells.aspx?ID=222) (self only)

**Abyssal Rot**  ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) The [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) condition from Abyssal rot is cumulative, to a maximum of drained 4; **Saving Throw** DC 29 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 3d6 negative damage (1 round); **Stage 2** 3d6 negative damage and drained 1 (1 round); **Stage 3** 3d6 negative damage and drained 2 (1 round)

**Dimensional Tether**   A creature hit by the bebilith's web Strike is [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33) and tethered to the bebilith, preventing it from moving further away from the bebilith. The restrained creature is also under the effects of a [_dimensional anchor_](/Spells.aspx?ID=70) spell (DC 29) with a duration that lasts as long as the creature remains tethered. The bebilith can have only one creature tethered at a time. The DC to [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) or [Force Open](/Actions.aspx?ID=34) the tether is 29. The tether can be severed with a Strike (AC 20, Hardness 2, HP 20); this ends the dimensional anchor effect but does not free the restrained creature.

**Penetrating Strike**   Against demons, a bebilith's Strikes count as [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=272) and good.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="">Adaptive Hunters</title>

Though it doesn't happen often due to their ability to shift planes, some bebiliths find themselves trapped on other planes either through magical binding or subjugation to beings of great power. While trapped away from their favored prey, a bebilith's hungers can shift. In such cases, the creature's penetrating strikes can adapt—a bebilith trapped in [Elysium](/Planes.aspx?ID=16), for example, might become a hunter of [azatas](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=10), and its Penetrating Strike would count as cold iron and evil instead so that it could target traditional azata weaknesses.
</aside>
